result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Velazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the Sex Offender Registry with DOC.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- No Contact with the victim(s) Hilario P. AP (07-21-06), KJD or Melondie G., without prior court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.
- No unsupervised contact with children 17 years of age and under.
- Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
- Agent to have access to all the defendant's electronic devices.
- Keep agent apprized of the make, model and plate of vehicles.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

from the victim, received and filed.  lms
*ordered sealed per court.*

Defendant Jose A Velazquez in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Melissa V, Hilirio P, Melodie G.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT for 11 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim(s) Hilario P. AP 7/21/06, KJD or Melondie G, without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* No unsupervised contact with children 17 years of age and under.
* Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
* Agent to have access to all the defendant's electronic devices.
* Keep agent apprized of the make, model and plate of vehicles.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
JOSE VELAZQUEZ SENTENCING MEMORANDUM, recieved and filed. lms
Court is down 8/28/2015.  Case is adjourned 9/3/2015 at 1:30 for sentencing in br. 6.  lms

Defendant Jose A Velazquez in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 10. Case set for plea hearing. Defense counsel waived an interpreter for this hearing. State placed offer on the record. Plea hearing proceeded. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court advised the defendant that upon a conviction of this offense he may be subject to Chapter 980 proceedings.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. Court ordered the Department of Corrections to conduct an evaluation pursuant to 972.15 to evaluate the defendant's risk of committing another sex offense. 
Parties advised as of 8/01/15 this case will be assigned to Judge Brostrom in Branch 6, Room 423 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Baltz phoned to reschedule plea date stating ADA Mathy did not object.  Case adjourned to 6-22-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.

Defendant Jose A Velazquez in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.

Defendant Jose A Velazquez in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Zachary Wittchow for Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.  (Interpreter for this hearing only.) Defense Counsel informs the Court that the defendant will not need the services for an Spanish Interpreter for future court appearances.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dugan, Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.
